title: I cannot downgrade Yolo V3 to opset 7, 8 or 9
body:
## üêõ Bug
I'm trying to export YoloV3 to ONNX to be used in a UWP project. The UWP has only support for 7, 8 and 9 opset versions, so I modified the file export.py to produce the opset version I need.

```
torch.onnx.export(model, img, f, verbose=False, opset_version=9, input_names=['images'],
                          output_names=['classes', 'boxes'] if y is None else ['output'])
```

When I try to export the model, I get an error.

## To Reproduce

To reproduce the error, modify the line mentioned above in the export.py file and execute

```
python models/export.py --weights yolov3.pt --img 640 --batch 1
```

I get the same error in both, yolov3 and tiny-yolov3


Output:
```
Starting ONNX export with onnx 1.8.0...
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/onnx/symbolic_helper.py:267: UserWarning: You are trying to export the model with onnx:Upsample for ONNX opset version 9. This operator might cause results to not match the expected results by PyTorch.
ONNX's Upsample/Resize operator did not match Pytorch's Interpolation until opset 11. Attributes to determine how to transform the input were added in onnx:Resize in opset 11 to support Pytorch's behavior (like coordinate_transformation_mode and nearest_mode).
We recommend using opset 11 and above for models using this operator. 
  "" + str(_export_onnx_opset_version) + ". "
ONNX export success, saved as yolov3.onnx
```

It seems that the export has been made succesfuly but when I try to import it in my UWP project the onnxruntime throws this error

```
'[ShapeInferenceError] Number of elements of input 'scales' must be same as rank of input 'X' and element type must be float.'.
```

I have to say I managed to import tiny-yolov2 from [here](https://github.com/onnx/models) in my project. Is it possible to downgrade YoloV3 opset? Or should I look for a way to train YoloV2?

## Expected behavior
A succesful export


## Environment
Google Colab

 - OS: Google Colab
